## Tender Description

The Correctional Service Canada is seeking an Elder to provide services to Indigenous offenders in Donnacona Institution – Gros-Louis, Raymond (Centre Wendat Arenatsi) and Port-Cartier Institution. The Elder will provide spiritual and cultural services, including guidance, teachings, and ceremonies to assist offenders in their traditional healing journey.

### Objectives

* Assist Indigenous offenders in developing an understanding of traditional Indigenous culture
* Provide guidance and teachings to staff and offenders on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Conduct spiritual services and traditional ceremonies

### Tasks

* Perform ceremonial and spiritual services for Indigenous offenders
* Provide advice and guidance to staff and offenders on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Participate in case conferences and provide information on offender participation in healing paths
* Report to the Technical Authority on a monthly basis

### Expected Results

* Provision of Indigenous programs and Elder services to the offender population

### Evaluation Criteria

* The Elder must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* The Elder must demonstrate knowledge and understanding of traditional Indigenous culture and spiritual practices
* The Elder must meet with a circle of Elders already under contract with CSC to verify the validity of their statement of capabilities

### Tendering Information

* Only Indigenous suppliers are eligible to submit a statement of capabilities
* The statement of capabilities must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the advertised requirements
* The closing date for submissions is March 13, 2024 at 2:00 PM EST
* Inquiries and submissions should be directed to Eloïse Clément-Ferland, Acting Regional Supply and Contract Officer, Correctional Service Canada
